summary: An email from Richard C. Curtiss to a New York Post editor, alleging that Jeffrey Epstein was murdered in prison and that guards turned off cameras, while also referencing his own incarceration and other DOJ personnel. The email includes forwarded correspondence from 2015 and 2019 regarding FOIA requests and official statements on Epstein's death.

persons.name: Richard C. Curtiss
persons.context: Author of the main email, claims to have been incarcerated in the same facilities as Epstein and Maxwell, alleges Epstein was murdered and that guards turned off cameras.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the email; his death by hanging in the Metropolitan Correctional Center is discussed, with Curtiss alleging it was a murder.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as being held in the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.

persons.name: James Comey
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to being fired from the Department of Justice.

persons.name: Rod Rosenstein
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to being fired from the Department of Justice.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: Former US Attorney for the SDNY
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to being fired from the Department of Justice.

persons.name: Kathleen Sawyer
persons.context: Cited in a forwarded message stating the FBI is investigating if criminal enterprise played a role in Epstein's death, while noting the coroner ruled it a suicide.

connections.description: Curtiss claims to have been in Jeffrey Epstein's cell in the SHU at MCC, implying they were incarcerated in the same facility.
Both are central figures in the sex trafficking case, with Maxwell incarcerated as Epstein's associate.
Both are mentioned as high-level DOJ officials who were fired.

events.title: Email alleging Epstein murder
events.description: Richard C. Curtiss sends an email to the NY Post editor alleging Jeffrey Epstein was murdered in prison and that guards turned off cameras.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center; ruled a suicide by hanging by the coroner.

events.title: OCME confirms suicide ruling
events.description: The NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner responds to an inquiry, confirming Epstein's death was ruled a suicide by hanging.

events.title: FOIA request denial
events.description: The Metropolitan Correctional Center informs Richard C. Curtiss that his request for information must be submitted via a formal FOIA request.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York City, NY
keyFacts: Richard C. Curtiss alleges Jeffrey Epstein was murdered in the Metropolitan Correctional Center and that guards turned off the cameras.
Curtiss claims to have been inside Epstein's cell in the SHU (Special Housing Unit) at MCC.
The NYC Office of the Chief Medical Examiner officially ruled Epstein's death a suicide by hanging on August 10, 2019.
Bureau of Prisons Director Kathleen Sawyer stated the FBI was investigating whether a criminal enterprise played a role in Epstein's death.
The email references the firings of high-level DOJ officials James Comey, Rod Rosenstein, and Geoffrey Berman.
